intro: Euphrasia dentata, commonly known as the toothed eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are toothed and arranged opposite along the stems, giving it a distinctive appearance. Euphrasia dentata is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
